DOC.detailed_description: Of nation 's 45 million adult smoker , nearly 20 million visit hospital emergency department ( EDs ) year . ED patient , particularly smoker , disproportionately low-income , limited access traditional primary care setting . Patients present ED tobacco-related trigger event , like asthma attack , may experience `` teachable moment . '' Thus , ED may ideal location identify smoker initiate treatment tobacco dependence . Initial pilot research group demonstrate feasibility ED-based brief intervention smoker . Based feasibility study , Institute Medicine 2006 report tobacco 2008 US Public Health Service guideline list EDs appropriate loci tobacco control effort . This study aim test efficacy ED-initiated tobacco intervention include counsel medication . The intervention—Screening , Brief Intervention , Referral Treatment ( SBIRT ) —uses form motivational interview know Brief Negotiation Interview ( BNI ) . Our propose intervention combine BNI initiation nicotine replacement therapy ( NRT ) fax referral state Smokers ' Quitline ED visit . A 6-week starter kit NRT ( patch and/or gum , tailor level addiction patient preference ) provide write material . The initial dose NRT give ED . A trained nurse administer booster intervention via telephone 3 day post-visit . The SBIRT+NRT arm compare standard care ( SC ) , consist write material , control trial 778 smoker age 18 year old randomize 1:1 fashion . The primary hypothesis SBIRT+NRT superior SC reduce self-reported biochemically verify 7-day tobacco abstinence 3 month . Secondary hypothesis include : ( 1 ) Patients tobacco relate diagnosis ED visit high cessation rate patient without tobacco relate diagnosis , ( 2 ) Patients believe ED visit smoking-related high quit rate others . The investigator conduct cost benefit analysis intervention . Follow-up assessment 1 , 3 12 month combine self-report in-person carbon monoxide test 3 month smoker assert abstinence via phone .
